description: Almost-squares: m such that m/p(m) >= k/p(k) for all k<m, where p(m) is the least perimeter of a rectangle with integer side lengths and area m.
links: Greg Martin, Farmer Ted Goes Natural, Math. Mag. 72 (1999), no. 4, 259-276.
mathematica: chs={1}; For[ n=2, n<=99, n++, chs=Join[ chs, Reverse[ Table[ (n-1-i)(n+i), {i, 0, (Sqrt[ 2n-1 ]-1)/2} ] ], Reverse[ Table[ (n-i)(n+i), {i, 0, n/Sqrt[ 2n-1 ]} ] ] ] ](*code uses alternate characterization, lists almost-squares up to 99^2*)
author: Greg Martin (gerg(AT)alumni.stanford.org); suggested by Jon Grantham.
